page.title: 06WALWORTH VILLAGE.
page.content: This small settlement is situated in the north east corner of the block. The population of the village is approximately seventy people, most of whom are elderly. The{bus service}runs from Darlington to Barnard Castle, through Walworth and Denton. The bus service runs on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays. In the village there are two{garden {centres.}The larger of the two centres has a stall in both the Darlington and Barnard Castle markets. There are seventeen houses built mainly of Magnesian Limestone. Some have pantile roofs of orange clay showing considerable antiquity. There are some more modern buildings and the farms have modern sheds. Walworth was once a much larger settlement in{Medieval}times which declined due to the Black Death,
